com.jova.calculator

Class CalculatorAdvanced

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jova.calculator.Calculator
      • com.jova.calculator.CalculatorAdvanced

  • public class CalculatorAdvanced
extends Calculator

    CalculatorAdvanced

    CalculatorAdvanced class implements an interface that enables the user to calculate advanced math operations such as integer part factorial and exponentiation. It also enables the user to check if given number has a property of being an Armstrong or Perfect number. For more info about Armstrong and Perfect numbers check the appropriate methods.
    Since:
    2020-12-23
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Srdjan Jovic

    • Method Detail

      • isCharNumerical

        private boolean isCharNumerical(char value)
        Helper method that checks if the provided char ASCII value is numerical.
        Parameters:
        value - Value to be checked if it is numerical.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the character is numerical, otherwise returns false.

      • isActionSupported

        private boolean isActionSupported(char action)
        Helper method that checks if the action provided to the calculateAdvanced method is supported. Returns true if the action is an numerical character or an '!', returns false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        action - Parameter to be checked if it is supported.
        Returns:
        Boolean value of true if the action is supported, false if not.

      • isCharacteristicValueParamValid

        private boolean isCharacteristicValueParamValid(char value)
        Helper method that checks if the hasCharacteristic mathod parameter is valid. Returns true if the parameter equals 'A' (Armstrong) or 'P' (Perfect), otherwise returns false.
        Parameters:
        value - Value to be checked if it is valid.
        Returns:
        Boolean value of true if the value is valid, false if not.

      • calculateFactorial

        private java.lang.Integer calculateFactorial(java.lang.Integer value)
        Helper method that calculates the factorial value for the input value. Input value has to be previously validated and be in the range of [0, 10].
        Parameters:
        value - Value for which the factorial is calculated.
        Returns:
        Integer value of the calculated factorial.

      • calculateExponentiation

        private java.lang.Integer calculateExponentiation(java.lang.Integer value,
                                                  java.lang.Integer exponent)
        Helper method that calculates the exponentiation using value as the first operand and exponent as the second operand. If both values are equal to zero, then it returns 1.
        Parameters:
        value - The first operand of the exponentiation.
        exponent - The second operand of the exponentination.
        Returns:
        Integer value of the resulting exponentiation.

      • isArmstrongNumber

        private java.lang.Boolean isArmstrongNumber(java.lang.Integer value)
        Helper method that checks if the provided number has the property of being an Armstrong number. An n digit number is an Armstrong number if the sum of his digits to the power of n is equal to that same number. For example 153 is Armstrong number because 1 + 125 + 27 is equal to 153.
        Parameters:
        value - The number for which the property is checked.
        Returns:
        Boolean value of true if it is an Armstrong number, false if not.

      • isPerfectNumber

        private java.lang.Boolean isPerfectNumber(java.lang.Integer value)
        Helper method that checks if the provided number has the property of being a Perfect number. A number is perfect when the sum of all his divisors including the number one, but not including the number itself is equal to that same number. For example 28 is a perfect number because 1 + 2 + 4 + 7 + 14 is equal to 28.
        Parameters:
        value - The number for which the property is checked.
        Returns:
        Boolean value of true if the number is perfect, false if not.

      • calculateAdvanced

        public void calculateAdvanced(char action)
                       throws NotSupportedOperationException,
                              NumberNotInAreaException
        Method enables the user to calculate the factorial for the current calculator state value, or to calculate the exponentiation of the current calculator state value to the power of some number in the range of [0, 9]. The calculations use the integer part of the current calculator state value and store the result as the new current state value.
        Parameters:
        action - The parameter that determines which calculation is going to be made. If the value is '!' then factorial is going to be calculated, for this calculation the current state value has to be in range of [0, 10] otherwise an exception will be thrown. If the value is a numerical character in the range of 0 - 9 then the exponentiation will be calculated and stored as the new current state value for the calculator. Other values will cause the method to throw an exception.
        Throws:
        NotSupportedOperationException - Thrown when the operator is not supported, as in not being a '!' character or a numerical character in the range of 0 - 9.
        NumberNotInAreaException - Thrown when the operation is factorial but the current value is not in range of [0, 10].

      • hasCharacteristic

        public java.lang.Boolean hasCharacteristic(char value)
                                    throws NotSupportedOperationException,
                                           NumberNotInAreaException
        Method enables the user to check if the integer part of the current calculator state value has a property of being either an Armstrong number or a Perfect number. For more info about those properties read the documentation for the appropriate methods that do the property checking. For both calculations the integer part of the current value has to be 1 or greater, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        value - Depending if this value is equal to 'A' or 'P', checking for the Armstrong or Perfect property will be checked. Other values will cause the method to throw an exception.
        Returns:
        Boolean value of true if the current calculator value has the requested property, false if not.
        Throws:
        NotSupportedOperationException - Thrown when the provided operation character is not equal to 'A' or 'P'.
        NumberNotInAreaException - Thrown when the current integer part value of the calculator state is less than 1.
